title: Langi Veainu
text:
Langi Veainu (born 3 November 1993) is a New Zealand <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> and <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> footballer.
She previously played for the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Warriors">New Zealand Warriors</a> in the <a href="NRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NRL Women's Premiership</a> and has represented New Zealand in both codes.
Background.
Born in <a href="Kawakawa%2C%20New%20Zealand">Kawakawa</a>, Veainu grew up in <a href="Christchurch">Christchurch</a> before moving to <a href="Auckland">Auckland</a> with her family following the <a href="2011%20Christchurch%20earthquake">2011 Christchurch earthquake</a>. 
Her older brother, <a href="Telusa%20Veainu">Telusa</a>, is a <a href="Tonga%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Tonga</a> rugby union international.
Playing career.
Rugby league.
In 2016, while playing for the <a href="Papakura%20Sea%20Eagles">Papakura Sisters</a>, Veainu represented <a href="Counties%20Manukau%20rugby%20league%20team">Counties Manukau</a>. On 6 May 2016, she made her Test debut for <a href="Kiwi%20Ferns">New Zealand</a>, starting on the in their 26–16 win over <a href="Australian%20Jillaroos">Australia</a> in <a href="Newcastle%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Newcastle</a>.
On 5 May 2017, she started on the wing for New Zealand in a 4–16 loss to Australia in <a href="Canberra">Canberra</a>. 
On 1 August 2018, she was announced as a member of the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Warriors">New Zealand Warriors</a> <a href="NRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NRL Women's Premiership</a> squad. In Round 1 of the <a href="2018%20NRL%20Women%27s%20season">2018 NRL Women's season</a>, she made her debut for the Warriors in a 10–4 win over the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney Roosters</a>.
On 13 October 2018, she started on the wing and scored two tries for New Zealand in a 24–26 loss to Australia in <a href="Auckland">Auckland</a>.
Rugby union.
In 2014, Veainu began playing for <a href="Counties%20Manukau%20Rugby%20Football%20Union">Counties Manukau</a> in the <a href="Farah%20Palmer%20Cup">Farah Palmer Cup</a>.
In November 2019, she played for the <a href="Black%20Ferns">Black Ferns</a> Development XV at the <a href="Oceania%20Rugby%20Women%27s%20Championship">Oceania Rugby Women's Championship</a> in <a href="Lautoka">Lautoka</a>, <a href="Fiji">Fiji</a>. She scored a try in their group game against Australia A and two against Papua New Guinea.
On 14 November 2020, she made her debut for the <a href="Black%20Ferns">Black Ferns</a>, scoring two tries in a 34–15 win over the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Barbarians">New Zealand Barbarians</a> in <a href="Waitakere">Waitakere</a>.
